newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed slightly easier on Friday, depressed by a small softening in the bund future and giving up some of Thursday's strong gains.
"It's been very difficult to trade in this market, a lot of my clients are starting holidays," said one dealer. "We've been up a lot recently and now people are taking a breather."

Dealers said they saw mostly interprofessional inquiry with actual business down to a minimum. "The most business we've seen has been in the 30 year (bond) but even that's been pretty small," said the dealer. Another said he had seen slight international interest at the short end.
Dealers said the bond market had been a little overshadowed by business on the Amsterdam bourse where the market slipped in huge volume related to options positions.

"People are getting a little bit tired of the stock market but that hasn't really translated into any action on the bond market," a dealer said. "Personally I think the bond market is offering good value and can go higher," he added.

At the long end the 7.50 percent January 2023 bond softened 0.02, giving up only a little of Thursday's half point gain. The bund future dipped 0.03 to 102.77 moving further away from the 103.00 resistance level.
